title: Huskisson Beach Motel, Jervis Bay NSW: Owner’s brutal replies to bad reviews
text:
WARNING: Graphic language.

A fed-up motel owner has caused a stir with his blatant replies to bad reviews posted online, calling past guests smelly, stupid and fat.

And they aren’t even the harshest of responses.

John Nixon owns Huskisson Beach Motel in the picturesque haven of Jervis Bay on the NSW South Coast.

Of its 398 TripAdvisor reviews posted by Wednesday night, 33 guests rated the hotel as “Terrible” and 32 selected “Poor”.

After staying with family at the property last month, one guest described it as “an awful place” with blinds too small for the window and having a toaster but no knife to butter bread.

“Sorry that your stomach blocked you from using the blinds, kettle and toaster!” Mr Nixon replied.

“Glad you and your family never return as you have been banned from all properties in the area :)”

media_camera Hotel owner John Nixon is not afraid to tell it like it is. Picture: A Current Affair

“I love it,” Mr Nixon told A Current Affair. “Can’t wait for the next one.”

When asked by reporter Brady Halls if he is Australia’s own Basil Fawlty, played by John Cleese in Fawlty Towers, the motelier said the character “probably puts up with a lot more”.

“Who writes a review on biscuits?” Mr Nixon opined.

In February 2019, “traveller1” wrote that it had been an expensive anniversary weekend stay with poor service.

RELATED: TripAdvisor ranks worst hotels in the world

“We were disappointed in the fact that the room cost us $305 per night and we were not even allocated biscuits,” the guest wrote.

“When I inquired I was most rudely told that our room number does not have biscuits.”

John replied: “Hi Biscuit lady!” and joked that the bay view rooms come with biscuits to fulfil such a “fetish”.

RELATED: Inside Melbourne’s worst reviewed motel

“My staff are highly trained in managing f***tards like yourself!” he said.

“Please don’t come back again!

“PS. We hope you changed that same shirt you were wearing for three days as it was a big job to deodorise the room once you had left!”

media_camera Huskisson Beach Motel. Picture: Facebook media_camera Huskisson Beach Motel. Picture: Facebook

media_camera Hotel owner John Nixon. Picture: A Current Affair

Another guest that stayed in July 2019 complained about not receiving a room with a balcony.

It was met with the following response: “The reason you have given this one-star review is due to your stupidity of NOT checking the exact description online!”

One woman, named as Sue A, said she was “very disappointed” about the stay including that basic things such as a bottle opener were missing and there was “mould everywhere”.

Mr Nixon began his lengthy response with “Hi dogbreath”.

“It’s the fact that you were not happy when I spotted the dog you attempted bring(ing) into the motel! NO PETS ALLOWED!” the owner wrote.

One person on TripAdvisor yesterday said that Mr Nixon’s replies were a breath of fresh air.

“Finally great to see someone not putting up with cr*p!” the user said.

“Reviews can be great but unfortunately give too many uneducated and unrealistic people a platform to voice ridiculous whingers.”

The contributor said they had never been to Huskisson Beach Motel but after the “latest publicity of the owner … it just made my bucket list!”.

Mr Nixon replied: “Make sure you ask the staff to call on me when your (sic) here. I will shout you a craft beer in the new restaurant I’m opening”.

Would you stay at John’s hotel? Share your thoughts below.

Originally published as Motel owner’s brutal bad review replies
